questions.question: A dust storm reduces your visibility. You should drive slower and turn on your:

choices.answer: Interior lights
Parking lights
Headlights

questions.question: If you plan to pass another vehicle, you should

choices.answer: Not assume the other driver will make space for you to return to your lane
Assume the other driver will let you pass if you use your turn signal
Assume the other driver will maintain a constant speed

questions.question: You are driving on a road posted for 65 mph. Most of the other cars are driving 70 mph or faster. You may legally drive

choices.answer: 70 mph or faster to keep up with the speed of traffic
Between 65 mph and 70 mph
No faster than 65 mph

imageMetadata.altText: Speed Limit 65 Sign And Electricity Pylon By Country Road Against Clear Blue Sky

questions.question: If you drive faster than other vehicles on a road with one lane in each direction and continually pass the other cars

choices.answer: Get you to your destination much faster and safer
Increase your chances of an accident
Help prevent traffic congestion

questions.question: Which of these vehicles must always stop before crossing railroad tracks?

choices.answer: Tank trucks marked with hazardous materials placards
Motor homes or pickup trucks towing a boat trailer
Any vehicle with 3 or more axles or weighing more than 4,000 pounds

questions.question: You are driving on a one-way street. You may turn left onto another one-way street only if

choices.answer: A sign permits the turn
Traffic on the street moves to the right
Traffic on the street moves to the left

imageMetadata.altText: One Way Arrow Sign Against Clear Blue Sky

questions.question: A large truck is ahead of you and is turning right onto a street with two lanes in each direction. The truck:

choices.answer: May complete its turn in either of the two lanes
May have to swing wide to complete the right turn.
Must stay in the right lane at all times while turning

questions.question: You may cross a double yellow line to pass another vehicle, if the yellow line next to

choices.answer: The other side of the road is a solid line.
Your side of the road is a broken line
The other side of the road is a broken line.

questions.question: At intersections, crosswalks, and railroad crossings, you should always

choices.answer: Stop, listen, and proceed cautiously
Look to the sides of your vehicle to see what is coming
Slowly pass vehicles that seem to be stopped for no reason

imageMetadata.altText: Low angle of car in front of pedestrian crossing and walking boy with smartphone

choices.answer: Always put one car length between you and the car ahead.
Look only at the car in front of you while driving
Keep your eyes moving to look for possible hazards

imageMetadata.altText: Attractive adult woman safe carefully driving car suburban road
